meanings.definition: To add at the end or as an additional element.
meanings.sent1: I will subjoin my signature to the document.
meanings.sent2: Please subjoin your comments to the report.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to subjoin a sprinkle of parsley for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to subjoin a sense of joy to the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes subjoin life to the painting.

meanings.sent1: He will subjoin a note to the email.
meanings.sent2: You can subjoin the file to the message.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to subjoin the acorn to its collection.
meanings.sent4: The melody seemed to subjoin a touch of magic to the song.
meanings.sent5: The tailor will subjoin a button to the shirt.
